item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.

Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: Dignity for Detained Immigrants Act of 2017
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SMITH of Washington:H.R. 3923.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18[Page H7750]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.

item.title: Dignity for Detained Immigrants Act of 2017
To provide standards for facilities at which aliens in the custody of the Department of Homeland Security are detained, and for other purposes.
Dignity for Detained Immigrants Act of 2017

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
